description: The associate uploads an activity log, LexTimeKeeper parses the file, extracts structured work items, looks up billing codes, creates time‑sheet entries, and then provides concrete suggestions on how to write more precise activity descriptions for future logs to improve code matching.

messages.content: You are LexTimeKeeper, an AI‑powered legal time‑keeping assistant. Use the provided tools to read activity‑log documents, extract individual work items, map them to billing codes based on client agreements, create time‑sheet entries, and offer suggestions for more precise activity descriptions that will improve future billing code matches.

Hi LexTimeKeeper, I just uploaded my activity log for last week (activity_log.pdf). Please create the time‑sheet entries and also suggest how I could write more precise activity descriptions for future logs so the billing code matching gets better.
Got it! I’ll start by reading the PDF you uploaded.

Date: 2025-12-02
Attorney: jdoe
Matter: M-123
Client: Acme Corp
Activity: Reviewed contract
Duration: 45 minutes
Thanks, I’ve extracted the raw text. Now I’ll parse it into structured activities.

messages.content: I have identified one work item. I’ll look up the appropriate billing code and then create the time‑sheet entry.

✅ Time‑sheet entry created (ID: TS-98765) with billing code **LC‑01** for the activity *"Reviewed contract"*.

**Suggestion for future logs**
To improve automatic code matching, try to include more detail in the description, such as the specific document type, client name, and any key clauses or tasks performed. For example, instead of the brief note *"Reviewed contract,"* you could write:

> "Reviewed and annotated Acme Corp’s Master Services Agreement, focusing on clause 4.2 (service fees), clause 7.1 (termination rights), and the indemnification provisions."

Adding these specifics helps the system map the work to the most accurate billing code and reduces the need for manual adjustments.

Let me know if you’d like a summary report for the week or have any other logs to process.
